metadata.title: CVE-2016-4472 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The overflow protection in Expat is removed by compilers with certainoptimization settings, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via crafted XML data.NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix forCVE-2015-1283 and CVE-2015-2716.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
lib64expat1 - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
libexpat1 - 2.1.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

libxmltok1 - 1.2-4ubuntu0.18.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1ubuntu1').
xmlrpc-c package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
vnc4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
tla package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
swish-e package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
cadaver package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
coin3 package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
matanza package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
libxmltok package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-4ubuntu0.18.04.1~esm1').
